content.title: Derivation of Planck Mass via Dimensional Analysis
content.summary: Step-by-step derivation of the Planck mass m_P from fundamental constants c, ℏ, and G using dimensional analysis.

alternative_derivations.formula: λ_C = ℏ/(mc) = r_s = 2Gm/c² at m = m_P/√2

verification.check_dimensions: [ℏc/G] = [M L² T⁻¹ × L T⁻¹ / M⁻¹ L³ T⁻²] = [M L³ T⁻² × M / L³ T⁻²] = [M²] → √[M²] = [M] ✓

content.physical_interpretation: The Planck mass is the unique mass constructible from fundamental constants. Unlike Planck length and time (incredibly small), the Planck mass is macroscopically large—about the mass of a flea egg or a grain of sand. This is related to the extreme weakness of gravity.
